data.text: @PaulKeeganGino @EHijacked @PippaPippapoppy Just got the kids back to school on Wednesday what a nightmare - the Covid was relatively mild but they had tummy flu at the same time 🧐

@supergran520 @EHijacked Not true the average age of death in the UK is 81 the average age for those dying with Covid is 82. I'm not suggesting anything just trying to point out that the fear tactics of government and MSM give no credence to age or comorbidity. Please don't put words in my mouth.

@GrumpyPete @EHijacked Since the average 80 year old still has 10 yrs of life left are you willing to give up 10 yrs? Are you suggesting that 60 year olds are old and sick? preexisting conditions can be diabetes,immune deficiency, certain cancer treatments, etc none of these will kill you immediately.
@supergran520 @EHijacked Not at all. Just illustrating that if you're old and very sick you are more likely to die than someone who's young and fit. Covid is imiterial in these cases

@GrumpyPete @EHijacked So do 40% of the population and many of these could have expected many more years of life thanks to modern medicine. A society can be judged how it treats its weaker members. You seem to think that it is ok to condemn the vulnerable to an early death?
@supergran520 @EHijacked Most of whom had more than one comorbidity. https://t.co/kYo4YmNzen
@GrumpyPete @EHijacked No. ONS data uses cause of death as certified by the attending dr. Now running at about 190k
@EHijacked @PippaPippapoppy having had all 6 of us with Covid for the 4th time the last 3 weeks can only agree - only because we have teens at school have we been able to get LFTests easily
